name: Narzissenkreuz
desc: The leader of the Narzissenkreuz Ordo, formerly known as Rene de Petrichor.

customize.text: Relationships

customize.name: The Narzissenkreuz Institute
customize.desc: A Fontaine orphanage, built on the ruins of the ancient civilization.

customize.text: An orphanage where Rene de Petrichor grew up.

customize.name: Institute of Natural Philosophy
customize.desc: Once a thriving research facility, this Institute now lies in ruin beneath the waters of Fontaine.

customize.text: An Institute where Rene worked with his friends, Alain and Jakob.

customize.name: The Narzissenkreuz Ordo
customize.desc: The Narzissenkreuz Ordo is the secret society formed by Rene de Petrichor and Jakob Ingold to create Neohumans in order to survive against the destruction of the world as foretold by the world-formula. It was declared an illegal extremist group and a criminal organization by Fontainian law under Iudex Neuvillette.

customize.text: An organization which Rene and Jakob founded. Narzissenkreuz, also known as Master, was the leader of the Ordo.

customize.name: Jakob
customize.desc: An orphan raised in the Narzissenkreuz Institute and later adopted by Karl Ingold. He became a Neohuman and the co-founder of the Narzissenkreuz Ordo.

customize.text: Rene's friend and a co-founder of the Narzissenkreuz Ordo. Narzissenkreuz was trying to make Jakob a Neohuman.

customize.name: Alain Guillotin
customize.desc: The adopted son of Emanuel Guillotin, who was raised at the Narzissenkreuz Institute with his adoptive sister, Mary-Ann. He is the founder of the Fontaine Research Institute of Kinetic Energy Engineering, with his most notable contribution to Fontaine being his research in Pneuma-Ousia, which led to the invention of the Arkhe system and the creation of Clockwork Meka.

customize.name: Mary-Ann Guillotin
customize.desc: The adopted daughter of Emanuel Guillotin and was raised in the Narzissenkreuz Institute with her brother Alain.

It seems to have stopped at a certain instant, the beautiful memory of a moment becoming eternal.

customize.text: Narzissenkreuz
Rene decided to become the first to free himself from the physical shell, embracing the name Narzissenkreuz.

<color=#ffffffd9>"...Farewell, I shall rediscover myself through water, and be reborn through water. This is a tremendous feat that no one else in natural philosophy has ever attempted. If it fails, I won't have to worry about the future anymore."</color>

Narzissenkreuz's rebirth did not occur, and Jakob devoted all his efforts to maintaining his condition. Rumors spread within the order about the death of the Master, which accelerated the collapse of the Narzissenkreuz Ordo. Jakob conducted numerous studies using the water of the Primordial Sea, Lyris's abilities, the technology for creating the ancient golems of Remuria, the records of Khaenri'ah, and the Holy Blade of Narzissenkreuz. Finally, he was able to place part of the consciousness of Carter Scherbius, whom he considered a brother, into the body of a Hilichurl, and, in the same way, he was able to "revive" Narzissenkreuz.

<color=#ffffffd9>"...I have named him. All that remains is to implant...</color>
<color=#ffffffd9>He will not remember his two previous failures â€” these setbacks could obstruct his path to transcendence. He shall become our ideal Narzissenkreuz. He shall take long strides and walk far ahead of me once more, casting his slender shadow in the sun. He shall guide us in shaping a new future, one in which there will be a place for Alain and Annâ€¦"</color>

Narzissenkreuz didn't remember his failure and thought that the trial was a great success. <color=#ffffffd9>"Everything has become consummately clear. All meaningless obstacles have vanished."</color> He acquired a new body, sent Jakob, Lyris, and Caterpillar to Elynas, and remained in the Primordial Sea to await the fulfillment of the prophecy and the beginning of the Apocalypse.
<color=#ffd780>Related Entries:</color>

customize.text: In the Wake of Narcissus

When the Doomsday Clock in the Narzissenkreuz Ordo struck midnight, marking the beginning of the apocalypse, the Traveler, Paimon, and the Oceanid Ann traveled to the Primordial Sea through the passage in the Tower of Gestalt and met Narzissenkreuz there, who was awaiting the beginning of the apocalypse. He believed that the Traveler wanted to prevent him from saving the world: <color=#ffffffd9>"Why, why has this happened? Why, why did you do this? The new world cannot be born. All will die in a shell, a husk of a dream!"</color> Narzissenkreuz realized that changes had occurred in the values originally entered into the world-formula, since he did not take into account the appearance of the Traveler, the witness of all, in Teyvat.
Accepting his mistake and defeat, Narzissenkreuz agreed to leave and reseal the Primordial Sea. Together with Ann, they went to Mary-Ann in Annapausis. There, he and Ann for a moment became ordinary children: Rene and Mary-Ann Guillotin, as they were during the orphanage. Since Narzissenkreuz had spent all his strength maintaining his will, he learned from Ann and Caterpillar what they had been doing in recent years, and disappeared, remaining forever in Annapausis.

<color=#ffffffd9>"During the first ten years, I focused all my power on preventing the dissipation of my will.</color>
<color=#ffffffd9>During the years that followed, I used that potent will to construct a universe within myself to resist my coming fate. That is how I held on.</color>
<color=#ffffffd9>I suppose it is the same for you â€” to build a beautiful dream out of the ruins of what was once our home. That is an incredible thing."</color>
<color=#ffd780>Related Entries:</color>

customize.name: Ann
customize.desc: An Oceanid created by the consciousness of Mary-Ann.

customize.desc: An Oceanid living in Annapausis. She is a hybrid consciousness Oceanid formed by the merging of Lyris and Mary-Ann Guillotin.

customize.text: Rene de Petrichor
Childhood

Rene de Petrichor was the son of the mayor of Poisson, Renault de Petrichor. Eduardo Baker, arrested during the purge of the Fleuve Cendre, was to be taken by members of the Maison Gardiennage to the Sumeru Desert for exile, but he was able to escape with the help of his henchmen, capturing Poisson and the members of the Maison Gardiennage. Journalist Karl Ingold (who would later become part of Rene's family) arrived for negotiations with Baker's son, Jakob, but the situation worsened with the arrival of the Marechaussee Hunters. The agents, including Emanuel Guillotin, staged a battle with the prisoners, during which Baker and both of Rene's parents died.

After this, Rene and Jakob were placed in the Narzissenkreuz Institute, a Fontaine orphanage where children of criminals were placed. The Director of the Institute was the gentle Oceanid Lyris, who was placed in charge of the Institute as a sign of gratitude to the Hydro Archon Egeria. The Institute's Vice Director was Basil Elton, formerly the head of Fontaine's navy. Rene met Mary-Ann and Alain at the orphanage, with whom he and Jakob became friends.
During the Cataclysm 500 years ago, the Institute was disbanded. Mary-Ann and Alain were adopted by Emanuel Guillotin, whom Rene blamed for the deaths of his parents, and Karl Ingold adopted Jakob. Rene himself stayed with Jakob and his new adoptive father. Director Lyris, who had the ability to dissolve and extract people's wills, became a member of the society founded by Rene a few years after the closure of the Institute.
<color=#ffd780>Related Entries:</color>

customize.name: Court of Fontaine Region
customize.desc:
"This city alone stands above all waters."

Towering up at the highest point of the city, the Palais Mermonia represents the highest authority in Fontaine. Under its gaze, the people lead orderly lives that are as regular and predictable as the aquabus.

Law serves to maintain a stable order, which is in turn the cornerstone that equity and justice are built upon.

customize.name: Belleau Region
customize.desc: Although much of Fontaine is covered by water, there are also mountains and forests. Mont Automnequi, which lies between the harbor and the Court of Fontaine, is one of its most iconic peaks. The Fontaine Research Institute used huge engineering devices to bore the Poisson Tunnel, thereby solving one of the biggest challenges facing the construction of the aquabus lines.

customize.name: Marechaussee Phantom
customize.desc: The personal unit of the Chief Justice Neuvillette, which is responsible for crime investigation. It is based in the Palais Mermonia and is one of the Maison Gardiennage's departments.

customize.desc: A handy length of abandoned copper pipe that was once used as a weapon. It was famous â€” or infamous, depending â€” in some circles.

customize.name: Basil Elton
customize.desc: Basil was a retired admiral of the Fontaine Armada, Captain of the Sponsian, and Vice Director of the Narzissenkreuz Institute. She died 500 years ago during the Cataclysm.

customize.name: Alain Guillotin
customize.desc: The adopted son of Emanuel Guillotin, who was raised at the Narzissenkreuz Institute with his adoptive sister, Mary-Ann. He is the founder of the Fontaine Research Institute of Kinetic Energy Engineering, with his most notable contribution to Fontaine being his research in Pneuma-Ousia, which led to the invention of the Arkhe system and the creation of Clockwork Meka.

customize.text: Sumeru Expedition

500 years ago, during the Cataclysm, Rene, Jakob, and Jakob's adoptive father, Karl Ingold, embarked on an expedition to Vourukasha Oasis, Sumeru. Rene became fascinated by Khvarena and the Sacred Lotus, Gaokerena, created by Greater Lord Rukkhadevata, from the consciousness of the former Hydro Archon Egeria. He observed that it shared a similar composition to the tissues in the organisms of Jakob and Rene himself but different from the tissues of Karl. Despite Rene's attempts to obtain more data samples to verify this finding, Shamaniyya refused his requests. In addition, he discovered some Khaenri'ahn records, with the help of which he later created the world-formula.
During his research, Rene unearthed countless books left by an ancient order and Khaenri'ahn records, which aided him in deciphering ancient texts. Using his world-formula, similar to Remurian "Fortuna", he deduced the imminence of another flood in Fontaine. After countless calculations, Rene received the same result: the apocalypse cannot be avoided. Furthermore, he discovered a method to extract "will," which he believed could offer protection from the flood's effects. Upon arriving in Fontaine, he sought to discuss the possibility of saving the nation with his child prodigy friend, Alain Guillotin.
During the expedition, Jakob, a child at the time, fell seriously ill and lapsed into a coma. Desperate to save him, Rene resorted to using powers akin to those of the Abyss. Jakob's body responded favorably to these powers, facilitating his recovery. Emboldened by this success, Rene incorporated the results into his ongoing research. Karl Ingold, however, harbored suspicions regarding Jakob's sudden recovery. To dispel these suspicions, Rene fabricated and altered diaries.
<color=#ffd780>Related Entries:</color>

customize.text: The Institute of Natural Philosophy

After the desert expedition, Rene was assigned to the laboratory of the Institute of Natural Philosophy with his friend Alain Guillotin and his assistant Carter Scherbius, whom Rene considered a little stupid. Although Rene and Alain had quite different interests and approaches to research, together they studied the powers of controlled annihilation of the Pneuma and Ousia that were contained in the body of every organism in Fontaine. Subsequently, Alain's studies led to Fontaine's energy revolution, making him one of the greatest scientists.
While working at the Institute of Natural Philosophy, Rene was struck by the conservatism of scientists towards new ideas, expecting an open mind from them. Despite his attitude, he tried to gain the favor of scientists for the sake of their opportunities and influence. Some of these scholars later became members of the Narzissenkreuz Ordo, almost worshiping Rene and Jakob. Rene was disappointed that the representatives of the Institute of Natural Philosophy could turn into believers, but he used their resources for his own purposes, which included the construction of the Tower of
Having learned about the illness of Alain's assistant, Carter, Rene decided to stop research in the laboratory and make every effort to cure Carter. He sent tissue samples to Sumeru, where medicine was advanced, in hopes of getting answers, but no one could offer a solution. Then Jakob put forward the idea of treating Carter with the help of the Abyssal powers, which was used to save Jakob during the desert expedition. After considering Jakob's proposal and discussing all possible risks with Carter, Rene began treatment. The Abyssal powers (Elynas's flesh) began to destroy Carter's tissues, and although Rene managed to temporarily stabilize his condition and stop the destruction, the treatment was unsuccessful.
<color=#ffd780>Related Entries:</color>

customize.text: World-formula

On one of Rene's trips to Petrichor, he uncovered the records of the Golden Troupe, established by the surviving Remurians that gathered here many years ago. Among them, he found the term "Fortuna" which said that kingdoms rise and fall, and when a civilization is annihilated, a new one will be born from the ashes. This phenomenon turned out to be similar to Rene's computational scheme, called the "world-formula." After countless calculations, he found a discrepancy with Fortuna: unlike the world depicted in these ancient texts, there will be no more new civilizations born. This apocalypse was associated with the ancient prophecy of Fontaine: <color=#ffffffd9>"In the end, the people will all be dissolved into the waters, and only the Hydro Archon will remain, weeping on her throne..."</color> Like the ancient Remurians, Rene wanted to escape fate and avoid the promised Apocalypse, so he founded the Narzissenkreuz Ordo.

Ancient Remurians believed that complete mastery over the body by one's will was the consummation of human virtue, a pinnacle that only gods and the rarest of mortals could come close to attaining. Following moral decay, the will became shackled to bodily form, willpower withered, and humanity became entirely enslaved to their flesh. The Remurians reached heights that were challenging to attain in study and differentiation of the spirit. According to the Harmost Aurelius, all phenomena were divided into four categories: Substance, Property, Quality, and Relation. Quality was the keystone, which is what is often called the "Quadrant of Qualities": memories, wishes, soul, and persona. Spirit was also divided into these four components. Among these, the state that came closest to the perfect freedom that divinities possessed was named "True Will." Ancient Remurians saw it as the detachment of human will with such meticulous research. Upon learning of this, Rene decided that separating a person's will could be the key to salvation from the prophecy. The God King Remus created imperishable bodies of stone and bronze for the Remurians. The Remurians wanted to create an object endowed with meaning, the essence of which would be determined only by Quality. One of these items was a sword forged in memory of the Harmost Euergetia. Rene wanted to create Neohumans and separate the will of the Fontainians to wait out the apocalypse and escape fate. At the Narzissenkreuz Institute, Rene discovered the Holy Blade of Narzissenkreuz, capable of uniting and concentrating the will of many people. In the Narzissenkreuz Ordo's brand of mystical philosophy, the Holy Blade was "reason," that which cuts everything open. It could only be born out of consummate human will. The Ordo used this sword to sever the people's will. Just like the Remurians separated their melody in order to escape the prisons of rotting flesh and gain eternal and independent life, the Narzissenkreuz Ordo wanted to get rid of the shackles of the physical body through the separation of the will.

<color=#ffffffd9>"...To excise the self is not to die, but rather to die before death. That way, there is no life to be ended. Thus may one achieve eternity. This step is vital, for by this, may one avoid receiving a Vision by some error. To receive a Vision to sell oneself to the "fate" of this world â€” to Heimarmene, and to evermore lose the chance to walk the correct path."</color>

In the records, Rene discovered the "Seal of Chymical Marriage" â€” a special magical technique left by the Golden Troupe. The technique consisted of two parts: "Circle of Four Orthants" and "Tree of Emanation." According to the Golden Troupe's records, there were several important places in Fontaine needed to seal the
Rene set the organization's goal to search for the Orthants and build the Tower of Ipsissimus in the center of the Circle of Four Orthants. The necessary points were found by changes in the composition of the water â€” in the right places it contained water from the Primordial Sea. All Orthants were named after the "Quadrant of Qualities": Orthant of memories, wishes, soul, and persona. The Tower of Ipsissimus originated from an old concept from the ancient Fontainian kingdom of Remuria and was used to describe a powerful will that could rule, sustain, and destroy the world. The tower represented the evolution of the human soul and the infinite mysteries of the world. The Narzissenkreuz Ordo believed that people continuously refine themselves through samsara cycles. These included Hyperborea, Natlantean, Remuria, and the first half of the
which humanity was presently experiencing. On one of the upper levels of the tower, the headquarters of the Ordo was situated.

On the ceiling of the room, a huge Doomsday clock was set, which counted down the time until the apocalypse predicted by the "world formula." The Tower of Gestalt was supposed to be a key element for controlling the will of people with the help of the Holy Blade of Narzissenkreuz and the abilities of Lyris. Three special keys were designed for the tower, capable of lowering it underwater and opening a passage to the Primordial Sea. When combined, the keys form a peculiar shape of three and a half circles. The innermost circle is the Cycle of Hyperborea, symbolizing the age when the world was frozen and the lost paradise. The middle circle is the Cycle of Natlantean, symbolizing the triumph over the evil dragon, a metaphor for humanity's victory over nature as well as the beasts within themselves. The third circle and outermost half circle are the Cycles of Remuria and Khraun-Arya, symbolizing the relationship between humans and gods.
<color=#ffd780>Related Entries:</color>

customize.name: Vision
customize.desc: Visions are external magical foci bestowed by Celestia and The Seven upon Allogenes, a small minority of people with strong desires, allowing them to channel a specific elemental power. Every wielder of a Vision is able to attain godhood and ascend to Celestia.

The innermost circle is the Cycle of Hyperborea, symbolizing the age when the world was frozen and the lost paradise.
